Structural Reforms are not always easy, have present political cost, but it is the only way to unlock the growth, make us + Competitive, the create jobs +
It is Crucial to keep up structural reform Effort to address long-standing weaknesses of our Economies. #EuropeanSemester
High debt levels are a drag on growth and make Economies Vulnerable to shocks. Debt needs to be Brought down. #EuropeanSemester
Main Reasons for concern are high levels of debt, vulnerabilities in the fin. sector and / or deteriorating Competitiveness #EuropeanSemester

RT @ eu2015lv [VIDEO] Informal #ECOFIN press conference on #BEPS and #CMU with #Reirs & @VDombrovskis - https://t.co/CdjlXRUYTZ http: //t.co...
This week I participated in #EPSCO #ECOFIN and informal meetings in Riga, thanks @uldisaugulis, #Reirs and @ eu2015lv team http://t.co/yBr1X2uQzU
#EC Proposal for the automatic exchange of information on tax RULINGS is a Crucial step towards greater transparency in corporate Taxation.
Tackle the aggressive tax planning, to ensure stable Revenue & well functioning Single Market, #EU needs to lead in the fight agst tax Avoidance
A single market for capital will unlock the capital and help it flow to the European companies. #ECOFIN
A stronger capital markets would COMPLEMENT banks as a source of financing. That would make the Financial system more stable. #ECOFIN
In Europe, most business Funding traditionally comes from the banks, with relatively little from the capital markets. #ECOFIN
One of Europe's economic problems is that our corporate financing is largely dependent on the availability of bank financing. #ECOFIN
@VDombrovskis: The European Commission has put forward a single capital market for one of its priorities. #ECOFIN
In order to reduce this dependency and to ensure attraction of investments, it is necessary to promote the capital market fin. access to EU companies.

Reforms are paying off. Ireland, Slovenia, Portugal, Spain and my own country - Latvia - grow faster after having Reformed. #ECOFIN
The experience shows That Reforms Mostly bare fruit in the longer-term, but They also have a positive immediate effect - boosting confidence
According to #EC @ecfin Simulations, GDP would be more than 6 PERCENTAGE points higher after 10 years, relative to a non-reform scenario.
#ECOFIN discussed the positive impact of structural Reforms on the GDP of the EU Economies. #Riga #EC #EuropeanSemester
This growth strategy Should be based on three main Priorities: investment, structural Reforms and fiscal Responsibility. #ECOFIN
Recovery in the euro area is Strengthening, but still is fragile. The EU countries countries shouldnt Implement a Coordinated growth strategy. #ECOFIN
#ECOFIN #Riga Focused on how to raise the Growth Potential in the EU, notably through structural #reforms and #investment. #EU #EC

My speech at @CES_Harvard @Harvard http://t.co/IAImNpLEmT Thanks to @chrisketels for steering the discussion http://t.co/RAUoteI4dt
With the US, EU shares a vision of democracy, prosperity & peace. Together we can Recover. Together we're greater than the sum of our parts.
#EU and #us Should take joint action to support #Ukraine in its Effort to build a secure, stable and economically developed country.
#Minsk Should be fully Implemented by all parties, to Avoid a risk of further Top Escalation of the Conflict. #EU & #us must not let this happen
Serious problems in # Europe's southern and eastern Neighborhoods: Turmoil in the Middle East and Northern Africa. Conflict in Ukraine.
#TTIP - it is important to address the diversification of energy supply sources by ensuring access to #us gas and crude oil. @CES_Harvard
Stricking a deal on #TTIP would help #EU and #us to Facilitate global recovery and growth together @Harvard @CES_Harvard
We can make big gains by Tackling the Remaining barriers to trade between about the EU and US - #TTIP is an important Opportunity for both-sides.
The EU and US are each other's Already Biggest markets When it comes to trade. The volume of trade between about us is over € 720 billion a year.
Deeper integration of #EMU: any further Top risk-sharing needs to go hand-in-hand with increased to the 'decision-making Powers at the European level
For the longer term, we need to forge a common understanding of what is missing in the institutional architecture for a robust #EMU @Harvard
#EMU: Several Already in place element - strengthened governance framework Economic, Financial backstops, incl. ESM & the Banking Union.
With deeper Economic and Monetary Union, Europe will stand stronger against future shocks. It's also the path to a real Economic Convergence
Creation of Capital Markets Union will help to strengthen the Role of capital markets in financing the real economy @CES_Harvard
To diversify sources of financing for the real economy, in addition to bank Lending, we Should work 2 Provide financing from capital markets
This growth strategy is based on three main Priorities: investment, structural Reforms and fiscal Responsibility. @CES_Harvard
The strength of Europe's recovery will Depend on our Member States putting in place a common growth strategy @CES_Harvard
Since the start of the Crisis, the ECB has gradually expanded its Activities - as the Fed & other Central Banks around the globe have done.
Btwn 2008 and the start of the Banking Union in October 2014 Europe's 120 Largest banking groups raised capital in excess of EUR250 billion
Banking Union has bail-in as a main Principles of bank resolution Reducing the risk for EU taxpayers to foot the bill IF banks make mistakes
New Financial backstops, ex. European Stability Mechanism - a firewall, Providing loans 2 Euro countries countries in balance of payment Difficulties
Fiscal and Macroeconomic Policies of the EU Member States are closely monitored. Recommendations are issued to correct Identified Imbalance
We now have an annual fiscal and Macroeconomic governance mechanism - called the #EuropeanSemester. @CES_Harvard
Europe has come a long way in reinforcing the Economic policy Coordination - new framework helps focusing minds http://t.co/X822yXM3C5
During the Crisis, we HAD to Tackle Economic Imbalance on an ad hoc Basis & the create from scratch the new economics GOVERN. structures @CES_Harvard
The Crisis exposed the Economic weaknesses present in many EU countries countries & in the design of the Economic and Monetary Union. @CES_Harvard
Recovery from a deep Crisis as the one we have seen requires decisive action from Economic policy makers @CES_Harvard
Looking forward to speak & exchange views on key Economic Challenges for the #us and #EU @Harvard Center for European Studies @chrisketels
